_description: Two fragments from a romance of Apollonius of Tyre — about 140 lines in quatrains

BodDou216.First Lines:
þat þe citesaynes wit gret deol hadde write hit to fore oure
                    eyȝeAppolyn gan to calle tarse douȝter wher euere þou
                    be…
BodDou216.Last Lines:
…[ ] reide he payne of helle o god lord & persones
                    þreoþe blysse of heuene dwelle amen per charite
BodDou216.Attributed Title:
Explicit Appollonius tyrus Rex nobilis & vertuosus et cetera (at
                    the end)
BodDou216.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             A New Boke about Shakespeare.
         London and Stratford-upon-Avon, 1850: 1-13.
Smyth,  Albert Henry. 
             Shakespeare’s Pericles and Apollonius of Tyre.
         Philadelphia: MacCallam, 1898: 249-55.
Raith,  Josef,
                        ed.  
             Die alt- und mittelenglischen Apollonius-Bruchstücke.
Studien und Texte zur englischen Philologie
         3. Munich: Huber, 1956: 78-84.
